experience: You and Daniel both know Bill Thomason

Instructor and curriculum designer for Branding Design Studios curriculum. Brand Design Studio is fundamentally driven and shaped by inquiry and experimentation into the overall future of branding and the particular role that design will play in that future.

Creating, writing, and teaching the classes "Design for Change" and "Design for Web". Design for Change focuses on using the design process and skills of a designer to positively impact the world around us. Design for Web brings the fundamentals of graphic design, typography and layout to the interactive space.

I am currently taking on select clients for 2016 whose values include positive change in the arts, environmental or health sector. I create branding solutions that include everything from logos, websites to books and products.I currently own and operate SOS Media, LLC. I do all the concepting and design, including logos, flyers, business cards web sites. What makes SOS different is the design thinking I apply to each project. Each design solution is specific, custom-targeted and results-driven.The process is simple. I ask questions. I get to understand each company. I learn about their audience. I research until I become an expert in the field. I know who the competition is. Then, in partnership with the client, I create a plan of action. Usually, that involves developing a set of messages to communicate with the client's customers. Whether those messages are best communicated via print, web or any other means is specific to each solution.
Create branding solutions for restaurants, clothing companies, and many do-good businesses.
Project Manager, Art Director, Graphic Designer
Create branding for educational products and companies such as Trump University.
Studied Visual Communication at a top-10 ranked design college in the USA. Teachers included: Al Sanft, Mookesh Patel, Andy Weed.
Studied Visual Communication at a top-10 ranked design college in the USA. Teachers included: Al Sanft, Mookesh Patel, Andy Weed.
I designed branding and packaging for print and web to help the organization promote themselves and the families they supported.
